results.title: Where I came from and where I am going!
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Michelle Tobin
results.brief_description: Michelle’s girls have motivated her and given her the strength to know herself. Michelle is a Yorta Yorta woman who has HIV, who loves her land and loves her girls.

results.title: Staying number one: The Swingers
results.creator_credit: Ray Argall, John Cruthers and Musical Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Pop Movie”.
Follows the quest for fame and fortune by the New Zealand rock group, “The Swingers”, in Australia starting with their hit ‘Counting the Beat’ and tracing them through their involvement with the feature film ‘Starstruck’, to their eventual break-up in mid 1982. Includes interviews with promoter Michael Gudinski, the group’s manager, and “The Swingers” themselves as well as several promotion clips.

results.title: The Models
results.creator_credit: Ray Argall, John Cruthers and Musical Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Pop Movie”.
Melbourne new wave band “The Models” are shown performing live at Bombay Rock and discussing their music, record contracts and attraction for playing in a rock band. Filmed on the eve of the release of their first album.

results.title: Battle for the land. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Ian McFarlane, Chris Bryer and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Politics of food”.
These episodes in the “Politics of Food” series examine poverty and hunger in Brazil. Brazil is one of the world leaders in food exports yet 1 in 8 children in poor areas will die from malnutrition. Much of the land which could be used to produce food crops is given over to high yield export crops such as sugar and cocoa. With little land to grow food many of the rural population have migrated to the cities where urban poverty is rife. As a consequence, corruption and violence are evident as the battle between wealthy landowners and the impoverished continues.

results.title: The Hunger machine. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Ian McFarlane, Chris Bryer and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Politics of food”.
Feeding the hungry of the world is not just an exercise in good agricultural practices or a result of foreign aid and trade. Governments can affect farmers by imposing tarrifs or providing subsidies so that even in times of surplus, the needy may be disadvantaged. More productive agricultural programmes can increase food supply, however in developing countries who receive aid and food, the incentive to develop these practices may not be encouraged by the political forces in power.

results.title: The Aid trap. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Chris Bryer, Derek Jones, Judith Weymont and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Politics of food”.
Wealthy western nations in more recent times, have given aid to poorer nations struck by disasters such as famine, flood and war. The primary purpose of aid is to strengthen a political relationship between allies. Both parts of the video compare situations in Kerala and Bangladesh in terms of food distibution and programmes to prevent problems caused by overpopulation. At the time of production, food distribution in Bangladesh was hampered by corrupt political infra-structures in some areas, while education was not a high priority. In Kerala the effects of sound educational programmes and a fairer distribution of resources was examined.

results.title: Soldered spigot joint
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.
Tapering the end of the pipe with special tool, opening out with mandrel, use of coning tool for shaping, insertion of brass liner and application of solder. Recapitulation in diagram form.

results.title: Solder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.
Making a roof cesspool by another method, use of solder. Consideration of materials used. The solder itself, wiping cloths, plumbers’ black. Preparing the work for soldering; method of soldering; tools used.
